III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A took a wire from a new television to chew on it. When a
staff member attempted to retrieve it, the youth was assaultive
and spit on the staff member. Staff member responded by pushing
the youth, causing the youth to fall in a fetal position. The staff
member crushed the youth with their body while trying to hold the
youth's hand to hold the youth down. Youth A has a superficial
abrasion with the surface layer of skin peeling on the left knee.
Investigation
Administrator was interviewed on 09/16/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Administrator reported there was an
incident involving Youth A on 09/13/2024, Youth A took the twist
tie piece off the new television cord and went to his room. Staff 1
and Staff 2 followed Youth A to his bedroom and attempted to
take it away from him. Youth A has a history of self-harming and
so staff were concerned Youth A may try to hurt himself. Staff
members attempted to verbally reason with Youth A to give them
the twist tie, but Youth A refused. Youth A punched and spit on
Staff 1 several times. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were attempting to
remove the twist tie from Youth A’s hand and that’s when Youth A
dropped to the floor. Youth A punched and spit on Staff 1 several
times, so Staff 1 left and Supervisor came and that’s when Youth
A took the twist tie out of his mouth. Youth A reported to the nurse
that Staff 1 pushed him to the floor and laid on him. Youth A was
examined by the nurse and the nurse noted Youth A didn’t have
any injuries but had peeling dry skin on his knee.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/16/2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a Shift Safety Coordinator and has
been working at the facility for six months. Staff 1 reported on
09/13/2024 he and Staff 2 went to Youth A’s bedroom because
Youth A had taken the twist tie from the new television. He and
2

Staff 2 tried to verbally get Youth A to hand over the twist tie, but
he refused. Staff 1 tried to get the twist tie out of Youth A’s hand,
but they realized that Youth A did not have the twist tie in his
hand. Youth A spit and punched him several times while trying to
get the twist tie from his hand. Youth A did fall to the floor while
trying to kick and punch Staff 1. He denied pushing or smashing
Youth A to the floor. Staff 1 said he left Youth A’s bedroom after
Youth A spit on him and Manager took over trying to get the twist
tie from Youth A. Staff 1 denied any other incident or issues
involving Youth A. He said Youth A has a history of attempting to
self-harm, so they were concerned with him taking the twist tie to
his bedroom. Staff 1 said he has completed all training including
MANDT training and has no discipline reports.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/16/2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the facility for 3 months
and hates being locked up. Regarding the incident, Youth A
admitted he took the twist tie that was around the television cord
and refused to give this to Staff 1. Youth A said he put the twist tie
in his mouth, because Staff 1 was trying to get the twist tie. He
said this happened in his room and he was sitting on the floor.
Youth A admitted he punched and spit on Staff 1 and that’s when
Staff 1 pushed him down on the floor but did not say that Staff 1
laid on him or smashed him on the floor. Youth A said Staff 1 was
trying to take the twist tie out of his hand. Youth A said several
times during the interview that he does not want to be at the
facility. Youth A denied having any injuries or bruises. Youth A
said Staff 2 was also in the room during the incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 09/16/2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Youth B is placed on Pod D with Youth A.
Youth B has been at the facility for four months. Youth B reported
there is always staff supervising and all his needs are being met.
Youth B reported witnessing Youth A remove the twist tie of the
new television cord and taking this to his bedroom. He said Staff 1
and Staff 2 followed Youth A to his bedroom and were talking to
Youth A to give them the twist tie. Youth B said the bedroom door
was opened, and he saw both staff trying to get Youth A to hand
them the twist tie. He witnessed Youth A spitting and hitting Staff
1. Youth B denied witnessing Staff 1 or Staff 2 push or smash
Youth A to the floor. He said the staff were trying to get Youth A to
open his hand. Youth B said he heard Youth A say he was going
to try and get this place shut down so he can be sent home.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 09/18/2024 via
telephone. Foster Care Worker reported she was notified of the
3

incident and believes staff did not hurt Youth A. She said Youth A
is very challenging and does not want to be in a secure facility.
She expressed no concerns for the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed on 09/19/2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor has been working at the facility for
6 years. Supervisor reported on the day in question she went to
Pod D, just as Staff 1 was walking out of Youth A’s bedroom. She
went to Youth A’s bedroom and was able to talk him into handing
her the twist tie. She said Youth A had the twist tie in his mouth.
Supervisor said Youth A told her Staff 1 held his hand to remove
the twist tie. Youth A did not report being pushed or crushed on
the floor by Staff 1, and he did report being injured or hurt.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 09/25/2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported on 09/13/2024 they got a new
television on the Pod. Youth A had stood on a chair and reached
behind the television. He directed Youth A to step off the chair.
Staff 2 noticed Youth A had something in his hand. He asked
Youth A to give him the twist tie, but Youth A refused so he called
for assistance. Youth A went to his bedroom and he and Staff 1
went to Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 1 attempted to get Youth A to
hand over the twist tie, but Youth A refused. They initially thought
Youth A had the twist tie in his hand, but when they open Youth
A’s hand, they didn’t find it. Staff 2 said Youth A punched and spit
on Staff 1, they attempted to try and restrain Youth A, but he
dropped to the floor and therefore Youth A was not restrained. He
denied Staff 1 pushed, body slammed or laid on Youth A while on
the floor. He said Staff 1 walked out of the bedroom after Youth A
spat on him. Manager came to assist and was able to get Youth A
to hand over the twist tie, which he had put in his mouth. Staff 2
denied Youth A had been hurt or injured.
Nurse was interviewed on 09/25/2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Nurse reported she examined Youth A on
09/13/2024 after the incident. She said Youth A did not have any
injuries or bruising, but he was observed to have a small patch of
dry skin on his knee. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed him to the
floor and crushed him, but he did not provide details about how
Staff 1 crushed him.
4

Video Review:
The video was reviewed at the facility on 09/19/2024 (note: video
has no audio). Video date 09/13/2024 of Pod D; Youth A is
observed walking towards the television, he stands on a chair and
gets something from behind the television, stepped down and
began walking around the pod with his fist clinched. Youth A
walked around for a few minutes then walked over to Staff 2,
playing with the twist tie, they appeared to be engaging in
conversation, then Youth A walked away. Youth A walked to his
room, opened the door and went to his room. Staff 2 followed
Youth A to his bedroom, a few seconds later Staff 1 entered the
pod and went to Youth A’s bedroom.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 09/13/2024 at approximately 5:25 pm.
Youth A took the twist tie off the television wire and went to
his room. Youth A punched and spit on Staff 1 several
times while attempting to retrieve the object.
• Medical assessment dated 09/13/2024 at 5:30 pm. Youth A
was seen in the clinic by the Nurse for report on chewing
metal wire. Youth A denies pain or injury to any area on the
mouth or teeth. Exam was normal and didn’t not require
medical care. Youth A was observed to have a small area
of superficial skin dryness on his left knee. No medical
attention required.
• Staff 1 personnel file: no disciplinary records.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews with Staff,
documentation reviewed there is insufficient evidence staff pushed
youth or caused injury to youth. The abrasion on Youth’s knee is
dry skin and not an injury.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
